description: Students study literary developments from the mid-17th to the mid-19th centuries. Topics examined include the influence of the Puritan Revolution on literature; satiric modes practiced by Dryden, Pope and Swift; the rise of the novel; the Romantic movement; Transcendentalism; and the development of American identity as seen in writers such as Franklin, Fuller and Douglass. Prerequisite: English 221.
name: Lit in Engl 1650-1850
title: Literatures in English 1650 to 1850
